hints.content: We can classify triangles by their sides and their angles.

###Sides

An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$. 

An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.

A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.

**How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{RST}$ have?**

$\triangle{RST}$ has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle. It also has $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.

$\triangle{RST}$  is both an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle and $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.

###Angles

An $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle has  $\goldE{3}$ angles that measure $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$. 

A  $\tealD{\text{right}}$  triangle has  $\tealD{1}$ angle that measures $\tealD{90^\circ}$.

An $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has  $\maroonD{1}$  angle that measures $\maroonD{\text{more than } 90^\circ}$.

**What are the measures of $\triangle{RST}$'s angles?**

[[☃ image 1]]

$\triangle{RST}$ has $\goldE{3}$  angles that measures $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$ so it is an $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

options.alt: A triangle RST with side lengths of 8 meters, 8 meters, and 8 meters and angle measures of 60 degrees, 60 degrees, and 60 degrees.

hints.content: $\triangle{RST}$ is a $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle, $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle,  and an  $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

options.alt: A triangle RST with side lengths of 8 meters, 8 meters, and 8 meters. There are 3 acute angles.
